actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 680.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 680 â€” "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1435) to amend the Clean Air Act to prevent the elimination of the sale of internal combustion engines, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4365) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."

The House received a communication from Pramila Jayapal, Member of Congress. Pursuant to Rule VIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives, Ms. Jayapal notified the House that she had been served with a third-party subpoena to produce documents in the United States District Court for the Southern District of Georgia and that after consultation with the Office of General Counsel, she had determined that only partial compliance with the subpoena was consistent with the privileges and rights of the House.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. McGovern to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 19.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Ben Cline to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
